summary: This document is an FBI email chain from August 2019 discussing operational planning for a search warrant execution on Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little St. James, in the Virgin Islands. It details travel logistics for approximately 40 FBI personnel, coordination with other agencies, and the status of the broader investigation, including co-conspirator service and evidence processing.

persons.name: Christina M. Bedford
persons.context: FBI agent from the Crimes Against Children Human Trafficking Unit (CACHTU) who is forwarding and authorizing operational plans for the search of Epstein's island.

persons.name: Sean P. Watson
persons.context: FBI agent in the New York office (Squad C-20) who is the primary author of the operational email detailing plans for the Virgin Islands search warrant.

persons.name: Leonard Carollo
persons.context: FBI agent (CID) who is a recipient of an earlier SCN (Sensitive Compartmented Information) update regarding the Epstein investigation and the island search.

persons.name: RDT
persons.context: An FBI individual (initials only) being sent ahead to the Virgin Islands to handle logistics for the search warrant operation.

connections.description: FBI colleagues communicating about operational approval and planning for the Epstein investigation, specifically the search of Little St. James.
FBI colleagues, with Bedford forwarding an SCN (sensitive update) regarding Epstein to Carollo.
FBI colleagues, with Watson stating that RDT is being sent to the Virgin Islands to handle logistics for the search team.

events.title: Logistics Advance Team Deployment
events.description: FBI personnel (RDT) are sent to St. Thomas to begin securing lodging, transportation, and coordinating with CBP and the Coast Guard for the upcoming search operation.

events.title: Case Agents Deploy to Swear Warrant
events.description: Case agents are sent to St. Thomas to swear out the search warrant for Little St. James and to conduct key interviews of employees.

events.title: Main Search Team Travel
events.description: The rest of the FBI search team (approx. 40 personnel) plan to fly to St. Thomas on an FBI Q400 plane, arriving around 7pm.

events.title: Planned Search Warrant Execution
events.description: The FBI plans to execute the search warrant on Little St. James island at 6am. The property is described as 70+ acres with several structures.

events.title: SCN Update Regarding Island Search
events.description: An SCN (Sensitive Compartmented Information notification) was updated with information regarding the planned search of Epstein's island.

locations: Little St. James (Epstein's private island, Virgin Islands)
keyFacts: The FBI was planning a major search warrant operation on Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little St. James, involving approximately 40 personnel.
As of August 7, 2019, all but one co-conspirator in the case had been served; the remaining one was a British citizen who was 'out of pocket.'
Digital media seized from Epstein's residence was being processed by CART and was close to being ready for review, while victim and witness interviews were ongoing.
The FBI was coordinating with Customs and Border Protection (CBP), the Coast Guard, and local authorities in St. Thomas for transportation and logistics related to the island search.
The operational plan anticipated the search of the 70+ acre island, with its several structures, would take 1 to 3 days.
